availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Archibald C. Cox (Green County sheriff and farmer)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky sheriff and farmer. Virginia native. Married Sally W. Howe Cox in 1822. Married Harriet W. Buckner Cox. Father of John H. Cox, Charles Cox. Held eight slaves in 1860.

bibl.p: KYR-0001-004-1972. Jordan Dodd, Kentucky Marriages, 1802-1850, Ancestry, Green County, 1822. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 126. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 217. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Greensburg and Alendale, District 1, p. 12. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 4. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Greensburg, p. 2. Green County Court Clerk, Will Book 4, Ancestry, p. 63-64. Kentucky Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates (1911-1955), Ancestry, 1913, Taylor County, file no. 11518.
